description: The SAXS configuration file specifies the parameters of a SAXS sensor calibration. It is written in the JSON format which governs the general syntax.

Tilt.description: The sensor, usually is not perfectly perpenticular to the ray direction. The tilt angle can be specified by giving the following paramters.

TiltRotDeg.description: This gives the angel of the tilt direction.

TiltAngleDeg.description: This gives the angle between the ray direction and the normal to the sensor plane.

BeamCenter.description: Gives the beam center in pixel coorinates.

DedectorDistanceMM.description: Distance between diffraction center and sensor.

Imagesize.description: Size of sensor image in pixel.

Oversampling.description: Oversampling factor for radial integration. The higher, the longer the setup but the higher the accuracy. More then 3 is probably overkill.

PixelSizeMicroM.description: The pixel size on the sensor.

PixelPerRadialElement.description: Expresses the width of a radial step in terms of pixels. '1' means :math:`\delta R\approx 1` :ref:`PixelSizeMicroM`.

PolarizationCorrection.description: The scattering direction id dependend on the light polarization. This may be acconted for with the polarization correction.

Fraction.description: Fraction of light polarized in the given (:ref:`Angle`) direction.
